resources.string: "Researchers have found that dogs use Earth's magnetic fields to align their bowel and bladder movements - and they prefer to relieve themselves along a north-south axis."
The outer ear of cat has 32 muscles which allows the cat the rotate each ear 180 degrees - and independently from one another.
The names dove and pigeon are used interchangeably, though the former generally refers to smaller members of the family.
The blue whale is the largest animal ever to have lived on Earth; it is larger than any of the giant dinosaurs were.
A gorilla can be identified by its unique finger print, like humans.
Kangaroos are marsupial animals that are found in Australia as well as New Guinea.
Large species of hawks reach the length of 22 inches, with wingspan of 55 inches. Hawks are characterized by sharp talons, large, curved bill and muscular legs.
There are currently 264 known monkey species.
There are around 372 different parrot species and believed to be one of the most intelligent bird species
A female rabbit is called a doe and male rabbit is called a buck.
